adjective.description: Relating to the North or South Pole.
Directly opposite in character or tendency.
examples: depression and its polar opposite, mania

noun.description: The straight line joining the two points at which tangents from a fixed point touch a conic section.
A variable binary star which emits strongly polarized light, one component being a strongly magnetic white dwarf.

origin: Mid 16th century: from medieval Latin polaris heavenly, from Latin polus end of an axis (see pole).
